#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=The victorious male departs with the female .
#Text=Image : Natasha Gownaris .
#Text=You suggest conservation efforts should look at protection of feeding grounds .
#Text=What sort of measures do you think might be beneficial ?

#Text=Because penguins migrate such long distances over the non-breeding season , a mixture of tools ( including no-take marine protected areas and traditional fisheries management tools , like catch limits ) is likely to be needed .
#Text=Although there is currently some spatial protection surrounding the species ’ breeding colony , this protection does not extend to their migratory route .
#Text=And , of course , everyone can contribute to penguin conservation by reducing their plastic waste , making more sustainable food choices , and reducing their carbon footprint .
#Text=What do you think might be causing pressure on food sources for the penguins ?
#Text=The two main threats to the food sources of this colony are climate change , which cause shifts in primary productivity and fish stocks , and fisheries .
#Text=Fisheries compete with penguins for fish species such as hake and anchovy .
#Text=Have you noticed differences in behavior among the penguins as the ratios become increasingly skewed ?
#Text=In a separate study currently under review , we have shown that aggression between males of Magellanic penguins is higher when the sex ratio at the colony is more skewed towards males .
#Text=We also showed that nearly all females at the colony breed but that , over time , fewer and fewer males find mates .
#Text=Single male penguins sometimes intrude [ on ] nests of mated pairs and interrupt the incubation of eggs or feeding of chicks , leading to mortality .
#Text=In some cases , they will even attack and kill chicks .
#Text=Your release mentioned sexing the penguins was problematic ; how did you achieve it with confidence ?
#Text=File photo of a Guanaco surrounded by penguins on Punta Tombo .
#Text=Image : furlin via Flickr .
#Text=We have some methods of sexing penguins that we feel confident about — using genetics or measures of cloaca size around egg laying , for example .
#Text=However , these methods are time intensive , so we have also developed visual cues for sex penguins ( bill size , behavior , forehead shape ) .

#Text=We looked at individuals that had been sexed using both a certain method ( e.g. genetics ) and visual methods to calculate how often we got it right based on visual cues alone and found that we have very high accuracy .
#Text=We also used statistical tools to help to deal with uncertainty in the sex of some individuals .
#Text=How well can you extrapolate population trends at Punta Tombo based on the birds you tagged ?
#Text=More broadly , how well do you think this work represents global populations ?
#Text=everyone can contribute to penguin conservation by reducing their plastic waste , making more sustainable food choices , and reducing their carbon footprint — Natasha Gownaris
